txt.en: 'Oh, and hobbits! Don't forget us!'
DNT Test Stars Firework
You take your place next to Merry and the procession continues
'Mostly untroubled!'
Wait for the Elves to take their places as the processional continues
Listen to Mithrandir's words of welcome
<rgb=#00FF00>Mourn</rgb> to remember those who did not live to see this day
Listen to Mithrandir's additional words of remembrance
Listen to the speeches by honoured guests
Some honoured guests have asked to speak some words at the ceremony.
<rgb=#00FF00>Cheer</rgb> for Sam
'I think that love and sorrow are often entwined, and each hones the other.'
DNT - Blah!
'If we did not know both, I very much doubt we would feel either as strongly.'
The speeches concluded, Mithrandir continues the wedding ceremony.
'But I have gone on for too long! Sam wished to say a few words as well!'
The time has come for King Elessar and Arwen Undómiel to exchange their vows, in view of the assembled masses.
The assembled crowd cheers for the marriage of High King Aragorn Elessar II and High Queen Arwen Undómiel.
Mithrandir's fireworks are as impressive as ever, and the celebration will continue long into the night.
Walk down the aisle and speak to Aragorn
Stand next to Merry on the southern side of the aisle
DNT - Blah!
Midsummer's Day has arrived, and with it the Great Wedding of King Elessar and Arwen Undómiel.
'Mae govannen, Peredhel. Uivered toled lín.'
'A le, meleth nín, suilad.'
'We are as two fair trees entangled beneath the Sun, rooted deep, drinking light together.'
'My heart has belonged to you from the hour I first beheld your grace beneath the leaves.'
Sam has finished reciting his poem, and the assembled crowd cheers for the embarrassed hobbit.
'You are my hope, the sustaining flame I bore unto the jaws of Shadow...'
'...the Evenstar who guided my steps through labour and fear.'
'Mainuvan melmetya, ter coivierényar ar tennoio.'
'Nai alaquen imbë ve' tuluva, ar la nyérë nehtuva vet.'
Aragorn smiles at you.\n\n'I am pleased you could be here, [placeholder], on this day of joy. Take your place beside Merry, my friend.'
'I will.'
'Mithrandir never fails to impress, does he not?\n\n'But I understand the ceremony is merely the beginning of the festivities this night? I hope to see you later, my friend.'
'So say the Men of Gondor.'
Watch as Mithrandir continues the ceremony
'We have not the wisdom of Elves, but this much is clear to us.'
Witness the marriage of King Elessar and Arwen Undómiel
'Love gives courage to stand against the hardships arrayed against us.'
<rgb=#00FF00>Cheer</rgb> for King Elessar and Queen Arwen
'Aye, Lord Elrond, even so. I have now felt such love, and I know this is true.'
Mithrandir's fireworks signal an end to the ceremony, but only the start of the celebration
DNT Test Flowers Firework
'Now, to the matter at hand...'
'When two are to be wed, the rites of both Elves and Men call for the exchange of golden rings.'
'Given events of recent days, however, perhaps it is best to... skip this custom.'
'Unless our lovers object?'
'Then let their hands be joined instead, and thus reveal their bond to all as they take their oaths to each other.'
'Aragorn Elessar, son of Arathorn, will you wed Arwen, daughter of Elrond, and henceforth be husband unto her?'
'Arwen Undómiel, daughter of Celebrían, will you wed Aragorn, son of Gilraen, and henceforth be wife unto him?'
'Then before the Valar and the One who stands above all others, and in sight of Men and Elves...'
'And sunshine rests upon the glade.'
'...and Dwarves...'
'Springtime dawns, and sprout and shoot'
'...and ALL FREE FOLK... let you be bound together, and the twin lines of Eärendil be made one anew.'
'Limn the lawns with golds and blues,'
The crowd murmurs with discontent at this mention of Denethor
'And with the summer’s flower and fruit.'
'The garden glows, awash with hues.'
'And what to thank for all these splendours?'
'None but the kind hands of its tenders.'
'Care well for the plots you mind,'
'Elen síla lúmenn’ omentielvo, Arimeldanya.'
Instance: A Wedding at Midsummer
'Love things that grow beneath the soil'
'All hail the High King of the South-realm and the North, and all hail the High Queen!'
'Though I turn from the Everlasting West, I am undiminished.'
'Foster them with thoughts most kind,'
'Behold! The White Tree flowers anew over the Kingdom restored!'
'An hour with you brings more joy than a thousand years apart.'
'When you embarked upon your quest, my sorrow was as none I have ever known.'
'I do not wish to speak above my place...'
'Now we are again together, and so shall stay.'
'Well, I was thinking about the Shire.'
'I choose Lúthien’s path, bound to your fate as was hers to Beren’s.'
'Most of you have never seen it, but it is my home.'
'Mainuvan melmetya, ter coivierényar ar tennoio.'
'It is a fair green country where we hobbit-folk live, untroubled by the world’s great trials.'
'Nai alaquen imbë ve' tuluva, ar la nyérë nehtuva vet.'
'Well, we have come a long way from the Shire.'
The procession is underway, and King Aragorn Elessar II is waiting for you to walk down the aisle to him, where he has a few words for you.
'You know the reason, husband of my daughter.'
'I will.'
'On that journey, a friend once spoke to me of the world’s perils.'
'And joy shall repay all your toil.'
'For is love not mightiest of all forces in the world?'
''There are many dark places,' he said. 'But still there is much that is fair.''
''Though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater.''
DNT Test Rings Firework
Your place, from where you will have a fine view of the ceremony, is next to Meriadoc Brandybuck on the southern side of the aisle.
'It was told to me by Haldir of Lórien, on the banks of the Silverlode.'
The processional continues while the Elves take their places atop the prow.
Mithrandir has some words of welcome for the folk assembled atop the pier.
'I bid you welcome!'
Mithrandir has called for a moment of silence to remember those who did not live to see this day.
'We come here in time of celebration, that we may share in the joys of peace.'
Mithrandir wishes to speak some additional words of remembrance.
DNT Test Eagle Firework
'Let us rejoice that the war is ended, and that love endures!'
'But remember too: the coming of the dawn does not mean an end to all shadows.'
'Long will the Ride of the Rohirrim be remembered in song, and with glad hearts!'
'Many are those who gave their lives so we might see this day.'
'Mai omenina, Estel.'
'Hail Boromir, Captain-General of Gondor!'
'Let us pause to remember those whose time has passed, and will not come again.'
'Long in the years of Men, but short by my counting, have I known the doom of this day.'
'Bravely did he defend his people from the threat of Mordor, with valour known to all.'
'Now let us speak of three whose deeds are worthy of especial remembrance.'
'It was to be the fate of Arwen Undómiel to part either from her kin or from Middle-earth.'
'Yet his greatest deeds are known to few; still, they were no less needful for Sauron's undoing.'
'Hail Théoden, King of the Mark!'
'Now her path is set, and this joy brings great sorrow.'
'And last... hail Denethor, Steward of Gondor until the coming of the King!'
'At the hour of Gondor's need his horsemen broke the siege, delivering the White City from its enemies.'
'Our roads shall not meet again ere the breaking of the world. Yet despite the pain it brings, I cannot wish otherwise.'
'Be still! I call for silence!'
'Why would I deem it so?'
'Speak no ill of what you do not understand!'
'Even courage to part from those dearest to us, son of Gondor?'
'Lord Denethor held your foes at bay, though the Dark Lord's malice tested him ever.'
'This is a saying of the Eldar, Frodo Baggins.'
'If not for these labours, this City would have fallen ere any help could come.'
'Few who stand here today could suffer what he endured for so long. Not even I.'
DNT Test Fireworks Finale
'But... let us now turn to more joyful matters.'
'The long night is over. And love and laughter come with the day.'
'Every wedding brings cause for celebration, but no marriage more than this.'
'For the blood of Eärendil's children, long parted, shall once more be made one.'
'Hmmph.'
'Aiya, elenion ancalima!'
'Let the Light you bear shine upon this glad union!'
'I call upon those honoured guests who wish to speak to come forward now.'
'Say on, Frodo. None here hold a place higher than yours.'
'Go on, Samwise.'
'Well-spoken, Master Gamgee. A ‘simple rhyme,’ indeed.'
'Hail Elessar!'
'Oh, I needn't, Mister Frodo.'
'Hail Undómiel!'
DNT Test Colours Firework
'Ah, well, it’s only a plain old rhyme, but...'
'Eglerio!'
'Age-long our garden bore no bloom'
'Praise them with great praise!'
'Left barren-cold and buried deep;'
'Far under snows of winter’s gloom'
'The seeds we sowed did softly sleep.'
'And through the wind and sullen frost,'
'They waited well and did not fade.'
'Now winter dwindles, cold is lost,'
